newsitem.title: UK: India traders outplay rivals on football pitch.
newsitem.headline: India traders outplay rivals on football pitch.

text.p: Market makers in the struggling Indian Global Depositary Market scored a rare victory on Thursday when they beat London-based rivals from the East European and Korean markets.
A three goal to nil victory in the final saw the Indians lift the trophy with a team made up of players from ING Barings, HSBC James Capel, Lehman Brothers, Merrill Lynch and Peregrine.
"We were stunning," said a market maker in the winning team. "It is probably the first time we have won anything."
The Indians' gritty performance on the football field has not been matched by the market they trade.
Indian GDRs are down nearly 19 percent this year and close to seven percent in the past quarter, while some East European markets are up 50-100 percent.
